expanded_description: Scientific notation is a method of expressing very large and very small numbers in a compact and standardized form using powers of ten.

core_concept.principle: Any number can be written in scientific notation as a number between 1 and 10 multiplied by a power of 10.
core_concept.explanation: Scientific notation expresses quantities in the form a × 10ⁿ, where 1 ≤ a < 10 and n is an integer. This format is widely used in physics to handle extreme values efficiently.

sections.introduction: In science and physics, measurements often involve extremely large or extremely small numbers.

key_concept.definition: Scientific notation is a way of writing numbers as a product of a number between 1 and 10 and a power of ten.
key_concept.context: This notation simplifies calculations and reduces errors when dealing with very large or very small quantities.

principles.statement: A number written in scientific notation has the form a × 10ⁿ, where 1 ≤ a < 10.
principles.application: Used to express quantities such as distances in space or sizes of atoms.

sections.introduction: Converting a number to scientific notation involves shifting the decimal point.

process_flow.description: Shift the decimal point until only one non-zero digit remains on the left.
process_flow.result: The remaining number becomes the coefficient a.

process_flow.description: Count how many places the decimal point was moved.
process_flow.result: This number becomes the exponent n.

process_flow.process: Assign the sign of the exponent
process_flow.description: If the decimal moves left, n is positive. If it moves right, n is negative.
process_flow.result: The number is now in standard scientific notation.

summary: Scientific notation expresses very large and very small numbers in the form a × 10ⁿ, where the coefficient lies between 1 and 10. It is essential in physics for clarity, accuracy, and efficient calculation.
